pageContext._xxxcollectionOwnerNamextxt: The Blues Archive, The University of Mississippi Libraries, The University of Mississippi
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: Contains papers, sound recordings, photographs and memorabilia relating to Richbourg's career as a disk jockey for WLAC, Nashville, TN, 1942-1973. Includes tapes of air-checks, primarily from the 1960s. Papers include clippings, articles and a brief hand written memoir documenting his career as a broadcaster, record producer and as an educator who founded a school of broadcasting for black students in the 1950s.
